item.title: iOS Dev Q&A
item.description: Uncategorized Mix String and NSString in NSRegularExpression methods is error prone. String use UTF8 coding (it see characters with variable lengths) while NSString uses UTF16 behind (it sees characters all occupying 2 bytes). For example, an emoji character counts as 2 UTF16 code points in NSString, but count as 1 Unicode EGC (Extended Grapheme Cluster)code point in String. let s = "ðŸŒ¹" s.count // 1 let ss = s as NSString ss.
